subclusters.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency in Reproductive and Stem Cell Aging
Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency in Aging
DREAM Complex-Mediated Repression of Somatic DNA Repair
DNA Damage Accumulation in Vascular Aging
Basal Somatic Mutagenesis and DNA Repair Decline in Aging

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency in Reproductive and Stem Cell Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA repair impairment causing accelerated ovarian aging via defective double-strand break repair and stem cell dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on SIRT6-mediated DNA repair deficiency causing genomic instability and systemic aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: RECQL4 dysfunction impairs multiple DNA repair pathways and telomere maintenance, causing genomic instability and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency in Reproductive and Stem Cell Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes DNA repair defects in stem cells leading to genomic instability, stem cell depletion, and premature aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DREAM Complex-Mediated Repression of Somatic DNA Repair
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes how DREAM complex represses DNA repair gene expression in somatic cells, limiting repair capacity and promoting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and DNA Damage Accumulation in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on endogenous ROS-induced DNA damage in nuclear and mitochondrial DNA driving aging and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Associated DNA Damage and Repair Deficiency in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights telomere shortening and DNA damage-induced senescence as key drivers of aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency in Premature Aging Syndromes
theory_assignments.reasoning: NER defects in Cockayne syndrome and xeroderma pigmentosum cause DNA repair failure and premature aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Accumulation and Stem Cell Dysfunction in Aging and Cancer
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DNA damage accumulation, repair trade-offs, and stem cell roles in aging and cancer risk.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Accumulation in Vascular Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA damage accumulation and repair deficiency in vascular cells leading to vascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Accumulation in Vascular Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details endothelial cell-specific DNA repair deficiency causing vascular dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Basal Somatic Mutagenesis and DNA Repair Decline in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of somatic mutations due to basal mutagenesis and declining DNA repair efficiency with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Sex Differences in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on sex-specific patterns of genomic instability, DNA damage, and epigenetic alterations influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency and Tissue-Specific Accelerated Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: NER defects cause tissue-specific accelerated aging via mutation accumulation and cytotoxicity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Chromosomal Aberrations in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes chromosomal instability and cytogenetic aberrations as drivers of aging and longevity differences.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DREAM Complex-Mediated Repression of Somatic DNA Repair
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details DREAM complex repression of DNA repair genes leading to somatic mutation accumulation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: PARP-1 Mediated DNA Damage Response and Longevity
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation by PARP-1 regulating DNA repair and genomic stability linked to longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response Decline and Immune Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decline in DNA damage response machinery (ATM, DNA-PKcs) causing DNA damage accumulation and immune aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Accumulation in Vascular Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights DNA damage accumulation, cellular senescence, and repair deficiency driving vascular aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Basal Somatic Mutagenesis and DNA Repair Decline in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-dependent somatic mutation accumulation and decline in genome maintenance systems causing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Deficiency and Genomic Instability in Vascular Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: NER defects cause genomic instability and cellular senescence in vascular cells, driving vascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Accumulation and Cellular Proliferation Decline
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mathematical model of stochastic DNA damage accumulation leading to loss of proliferative capacity and cell death.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Integrity and Structural Variation in Longevity
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on maintenance of genomic integrity via reduced CNVs and structural variants as a driver of longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA-Protein Crosslink Repair and Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: SPRTN-mediated repair of DNA-protein crosslinks protects genome stability and prevents aging-related damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Double Strand Break Repair and Chromatin Stability in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes decline in DSB repair and chromatin remodeling causing genomic instability and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Dysfunction in Menopause and Systemic Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Genetic variants impairing DNA repair cause systemic aging that drives reproductive aging and menopause.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Base Excision Repair Deficiency and Oxidative DNA Damage in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Reduced BER capacity, especially DNA polymerase beta deficiency, leads to oxidative DNA damage accumulation and aging.
